snippet: New election rules in California, once a symbol of government dysfunction, may be having their desired effect of leaching some of the partisanship out of politics.
abstract: California, once a symbol of government dysfunction, has been stage of series of unlikely legislative success; new atmosphere offers first evidence that three major changes in California's governance system intended to leach some of the partisanship out of politics, which include redistricting rules, easing of stringent term limits and allowing unauthorized immigrants to obtain driver's licenses, are working.
lead_paragraph: New election rules in California, once a symbol of government dysfunction, may be having their desired effect of leaching some of the partisanship out of politics.

headline.main: California Sees Gridlock Ease in Governing
headline.print_headline: California Sees Gridlock Ease In Governing
